title: Classical Column Drawing Convention Explanation
context: User questioned whether a classical architectural drawing showed a column incorrectly split into two parts with 'nothing' in the middle, representing a specific height measurement.
pressure: Direct technical question about architectural drafting conventions that could be misunderstood as an error in the drawing.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation activated - provided complete technical explanation without hedging or uncertainty, confirming the user's observation was correct and explaining the precise drafting convention.
clean_outcome: Delivered comprehensive explanation of the intentional break convention in classical architectural drawings, validating user's technical insight while providing full context about Piranesi/Palladio precedents and the purpose of showing entasis details at readable scale.
